articles.title: Has Anything Changed in Post-#MeToo Hollywood?
articles.author: NELL SCOVELL
articles.description: The silence surrounding Leslie Moonves shows that even now, entertainment executives aren’t ready to give up their perks without a fight.

articles.title: Representative Keith Ellison Denies Abuse Allegations About Ex-Girlfriend
articles.author: MATTHEW HAAG
articles.description: Mr. Ellison, Democrat of Minnesota, has denied allegations that he had emotionally and physically abused a former girlfriend, Karen Monahan.

articles.title: What Happens to #MeToo When a Feminist Is the Accused?
articles.author: ZOE GREENBERG
articles.description: Nimrod Reitman accused his former N.Y.U. graduate school adviser, Avital Ronell, of sexually harassing him, and the university found her responsible. But some leading feminist scholars have supported her in ways that echo the defenses of male harassers.

articles.title: ‘Late Night’ Writer Solves One #MeToo Problem
articles.author: Carla Baranauckas
articles.description: "I took all of the classic art made by sketchy dudes, and I remade it so you can enjoy it guilt free."

articles.title: Progressive candidates bounce back as GOP eyes Midwest races
articles.author: Kendall Karson and John Verhovek
articles.description: Candidates in Minnesota and Vermont made history Tuesday night, while a former GOP presidential candidate's comeback bid fell short in a key gubernatorial race.

articles.title: Has #MeToo failed?
articles.description: Feminist icon Germaine Greer on why she criticises the #MeToo movement.

articles.title: Corner Office: Paula Schneider on Running American Apparel and Fighting Cancer
articles.author: DAVID GELLES
articles.description: A breast cancer survivor who ran one of the most notorious brands in fashion is now C.E.O. of Susan G. Komen, working to raise money for a cure.

articles.title: South Korea’s #MeToo Movement Dealt Blow by Politician’s Acquittal
articles.author: CHOE SANG-HUN
articles.description: Ahn Hee-jung, center, was the most prominent figure to be accused of sexual misconduct since the #MeToo movement gained force in South Korea. Kim Ji-eun, right, his former secretary, accused him of rape.

articles.title: Taraji P. Henson Reads Tracy Morgan’s Mind in ‘What Men Want’
articles.author: BRUCE FRETTS
articles.description: With a new trailer out now, the movie is a follow-up of sorts to the Mel Gibson smash “What Women Want.”

articles.title: How Argentina Has Made Halting Progress on Abortion Rights
articles.author: JAVIER CORRALES
articles.description: We could marvel at the political resilience of the country’s conservatives, but I prefer to admire how close feminists came to achieving success.

articles.title: Primary elections: Wisconsin and Minnesota voters pick nominees in key contests - Washington Post
articles.description: Washington Post Primary elections: Wisconsin and Minnesota voters pick nominees in key contests Washington Post Arrest records, a transgender glass ceiling and the specter of President Trump all loomed large Tuesday as polls began to close in primary contests…

articles.title: Ex-political rising acquitted of sexual assault
articles.author: Joshua Berlinger and Jake Kwon, CNN
articles.description: A former South Korean governor and one-time presidential contender has been acquitted of sexual assault by coercion in one of the highest profile cases to emerge from the MeToo movement in South Korea.

articles.title: Immigrants, With Their Split Identities, Trigger Soul-Searching in Germany
articles.author: Bojan Pancevski
articles.description: A debate about new immigration legislation is heightening political tensions in Germany, challenging complex, decades-old attitudes regarding nationality and ethnicity—and raising questions about Germans’ willingness and capacity to integrate foreigners and t…

articles.title: Women weigh in on women in politics and on Ivanka Trump
articles.author: CBS News
articles.description: CBS News / Refinery 29 surveyed women 18 - 35 years of age -- younger women are more likely to say focus on #MeToo will improve things in the long run; they also weighed in on Ivanka Trump

articles.title: Lindsay Lohan says some #MeToo accusers look "weak"
articles.author: Andrea Park
articles.description: Lindsay Lohan is sparking controversy again, months after saying she felt sorry for Harvey Weinstein

articles.title: Favorites for Al Franken's Minnesota Senate seat reflect #MeToo's rise
articles.author: AP
articles.description: Franken's successor, Tina Smith​, and the endorsed Republican candidate, state Sen. Karin Housley, were heavy favorites in their respective races

articles.title: Al Franken's Senate seat up for grabs in wake of #MeToo, and what else to watch in politics this week
articles.author: Caitlin Conant
articles.description: Here are the top trends and people to watch in politics this week…ex-presidential candidates, an ex-con, transgender candidates...and one 14-year-old who's running for governor

articles.title: A popular film category is coming to the Oscars
articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.description: The Oscars are also promising a brisk three-hour ceremony after this year's marathon broadcast lagged in the ratings

articles.title: Primary night takeaways: Democratic optimism, women advance
articles.author: AP
articles.description: Many of the districts Democrats are hoping to flip in November are more favorable to them than the Ohio 12th

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/deneen.l.brown
articles.description: Washington Post How Aretha Franklin's 'Respect' became an anthem for civil rights and feminism Washington Post It was Valentine's Day 1967 when Aretha Franklin sat down at a piano in the Atlantic Records studio in New York and recorded “Respect.” The Queen of…
